page.title: 14HOUSING
page.content: {Chelford}has no outstanding buildings, architecturally. There are a number of old buildings, e.g. Abbey Farm,the old Vicarage,The Manor House, etc. None of them are open to the Public. The Manor House is the most interesting,having begun life as a cruck cottage(?14th Cent.) being added to every century since. The church is of a simple design as is the 1892 school. The largest building in the block is a large,ugly, brick-built government food store by the railway (south of the station). The railway station is being rebuilt in brick. The present village is mainly Victorian, the newer housing being just to the north of the boundary of this block. There is but one Public House(The Dixon Arms) in the block,the two in the original village being long closed down. Withington Hall is largely unseen.
